meanings.definition: A loose-fitting tunic or shirt worn by men in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: In ancient Rome, men would wear a camisia for comfort.
meanings.sent2: The camisia was a common garment for men in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his camisia was so big, it could fit two people inside!
meanings.sent4: His camisia was like a billowing cloud around him, giving him an air of mystery.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the camisia felt like a gentle hug against his skin.
